2:T72a,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Recipe","name":"Submarino","description":"Argentina's charming take on hot chocolate — a bar of dark chocolate 'submarined' into a cup of steaming hot milk, where it slowly melts as you stir. A café ritual loved by kids and adults alike.","image":"https://expatsargentina.com/images/recipes/submarino.webp","author":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Expats Argentina"},"datePublished":"2025-01-01","prepTime":"PT2M","cookTime":"PT5M","totalTime":"PT7M","recipeYield":"1 servings","recipeCategory":"dessert","recipeCuisine":"Argentine","keywords":"submarino recipe, argentine hot chocolate, submarino argentina, chocolate con leche, buenos aires cafe drink","nutrition":{"@type":"NutritionInformation","calories":"320 calories","proteinContent":"10g","carbohydrateContent":"32g","fatContent":"18g"},"recipeIngredient":["250ml (1 cup) whole milk","1 bar (40-50g) dark or milk chocolate (Águila brand is traditional)","Sugar to taste (optional)"],"recipeInstructions":[{"@type":"HowToStep","position":1,"text":"Heat the milk in a small saucepan over medium heat until steaming hot but not boiling. Small bubbles should form around the edges."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":2,"text":"Pour the hot milk into a wide cup or mug."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":3,"text":"Place the chocolate bar on a small plate or saucer beside the cup."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":4,"text":"To drink, plunge the chocolate bar into the hot milk — the 'submarine' — and let it sit for 30 seconds."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":5,"text":"Stir gently with a spoon, watching the chocolate melt and swirl into the milk."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":6,"text":"Continue stirring until the chocolate is fully dissolved or enjoy it in stages, alternating between milky sips and chocolatey ones."}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-b from-orange-50 15:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","ul",null,{"className":"space-y-3","children":[["$","li","0",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"The quality of the chocolate bar makes all the difference. In Argentina, Águila chocolate bars are the classic choice. Use any good-quality chocolate with at least 50% cacao."}]]}],["$","li","1",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Don't boil the milk — it needs to be hot enough to melt the chocolate but not scalded, which changes the taste."}]]}],["$","li","2",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"This is a ritual, not a recipe. The pleasure is in the slow melting and stirring. Don't rush it."}]]}]]}]}]
16:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","id":"history","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-history w-5 h-5 text-orange-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1357e3",{"d":"M3 12a9 9 0 1 0 9-9 9.75 9.75 0 0 0-6.74 2.74L3 8"}],["$","path","1xhq8a",{"d":"M3 3v5h5"}],["$","path","1fdv2h",{"d":"M12 7v5l4 2"}],"$undefined"]}],"The Story Behind the Dish"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed","children":"The submarino (literally 'submarine') is a beloved Argentine café tradition. Rather than pre-mixing cocoa powder into milk, cafés serve a cup of steaming hot milk with a bar of chocolate on the side. You plunge the chocolate into the milk — like a submarine diving — and stir as it melts. The ritual of watching the chocolate dissolve is half the pleasure. It's a winter staple in every confitería (café) in Argentina, and a rite of childhood."}]}]]}]
